item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 4:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Reverse-engineering and analysis of SanDisk High Endurance microSDXC card (2020) (145 points | 46 comments)
2. Show HN: Lume – OS lightweight CLI for MacOS & Linux VMs on Apple Silicon. (116 points | 27 comments)
3. Life Is More Than an Engineering Problem – Interview with Ted Chiang (163 points | 60 comments)
4. Analyzing the codebase of Caffeine: a high performance caching library (107 points | 11 comments)
5. Show HN: ESP32 RC Cars (178 points | 25 comments)
6. Fossilised fish vomit found in Denmark from sixty-six million years ago (45 points | 15 comments)
7. Fixing Left and Mutual Recursions in Grammars (66 points | 16 comments)
8. Macrodata Refinement (445 points | 242 comments)
9. Show HN: Modest – musical harmony library for Lua (35 points | 5 comments)
10. RLHF Book (318 points | 25 comments)
11. Recent results show that LLMs struggle with compositional tasks (242 points | 190 comments)
12. A Rust procedural language handler for PostgreSQL (71 points | 17 comments)
13. Researchers combine holograms and AI to create uncrackable optical encryption (6 points | 2 comments)
14. Bzip3: A spiritual successor to BZip2 (290 points | 154 comments)
15. AstroForge selects target for "high risk, seat of the pants" asteroid mission (46 points | 12 comments)
16. Pointers Are Complicated II, or: We need better language specs (2020) (132 points | 65 comments)
17. A bookmarklet to kill sticky headers (2013) (177 points | 73 comments)
18. The Doctor Who Drank Infectious Broth and Solved a Medical Mystery (2010) (27 points | 25 comments)
19. Visualizing all books of the world in ISBN-Space (426 points | 82 comments)
20. Python 3, Pygame, and Debian Bookworm on the Miyoo A30 (141 points | 26 comments)
21. Enhancing your MIDI devices with Perl (99 points | 22 comments)
22. String of recent killings linked to Bay Area 'Zizians' (528 points | 679 comments)
23. LMD: A new, less wasteful metal 3D printing technique (93 points | 24 comments)
24. Sound & Efficient Generation of DOP Exploits via Programming Language Synthesis [pdf] (14 points | discuss)
25. The origin and unexpected evolution of the word "mainframe" (111 points | 31 comments)
26. Archivists work to save disappearing data.gov datasets (630 points | 188 comments)
27. A mouseless tale: trying for a keyboard-driven desktop (114 points | 67 comments)
28. CDC orders mass retraction and revision of submitted research (719 points | 480 comments)
29. Engineered waterways helped Ancient Amazonians became master maize farmers (35 points | 2 comments)
30. Show HN: Hollow – A Customizable Digital Workspace (7 points | 8 comments)
